page.title: 03Farming
page.content: As elsewhere in the southern Lake District, the farming economy is based on sheep and cattle. In recent years, several farms have been amalgamated so that now, there are only two farms within the survey area, although quite a lot of land is owned by Kentmere Hall which lies just beyond it to the north. (Most of the former farm buildings have been converted in to private homes). The majority of the sheep are Swaledale or "Swaleys" and Herdwick, with some Rough Fell. Cattle are mostly Friesian store cattle. As far as possible, hay and silage for winter fodder is provided off the farm but a major proportion of the survey area is rough grazing so shortages do occur, especially when the summer is poor.
